subdomains.name: Point-Set Topology
subdomains.description: The foundation of topology: open sets, continuity, compactness, and connectedness in abstract spaces.
subdomains.flavor: The Fabric of Space — where the very notion of 'nearness' is defined without distance.

topics.name: Topological Spaces & Open Sets
topics.description: Defining topology through open sets. The most general notion of space and continuity.
topics.flavor: Forget distance — all you need is the idea of openness.

topics.name: Continuity & Homeomorphisms
topics.description: Continuous maps between topological spaces. Homeomorphisms as the isomorphisms of topology.
topics.flavor: A coffee mug and a donut are the same — topologically speaking.

topics.name: Compactness
topics.description: Finite subcovers from open covers. The topological generalization of closed and bounded sets.
topics.flavor: The mathematical art of fitting infinity into a finite package.

topics.name: Connectedness
topics.description: Spaces that cannot be split into two disjoint open sets. Path-connectedness and components.
topics.flavor: A space in one piece — no cuts, no gaps, no separation.

topics.name: Metric Spaces
topics.description: Topological spaces with a distance function. Completeness, Cauchy sequences, and Baire category.
topics.flavor: When you can measure distance, topology gains a ruler.

subdomains.name: Algebraic Topology
subdomains.description: Using algebraic structures to classify topological spaces. Homotopy, homology, and the bridge between algebra and geometry.
subdomains.flavor: The Rosetta Stone — translating geometric puzzles into algebraic equations.

topics.name: Fundamental Group
topics.description: Loops in a space, up to continuous deformation. The first homotopy group that detects holes.
topics.flavor: Walk in a loop — can you shrink it to a point? The answer reveals the space's soul.

topics.name: Covering Spaces
topics.description: Spaces that locally look like another space. Universal covers and deck transformations.
topics.flavor: Unwrapping a space to see its hidden symmetries.

topics.name: Homology
topics.description: Detecting holes of all dimensions using chains, cycles, and boundaries. The Betti numbers.
topics.flavor: Counting holes — not just tunnels, but cavities and voids in every dimension.

topics.name: Cohomology
topics.description: The dual of homology. Cohomology rings, cup products, and de Rham cohomology.
topics.flavor: Homology's mirror image — where holes gain an algebraic multiplication.

topics.name: Higher Homotopy
topics.description: Higher homotopy groups, fibrations, and the Hurewicz theorem. Beyond the fundamental group.
topics.flavor: Higher-dimensional loops probing higher-dimensional holes.

subdomains.name: Surfaces & Manifolds
subdomains.description: Two-dimensional manifolds and their classification. The topology of shapes we can visualize.
subdomains.flavor: The Shape Gallery — from the sphere to the Klein bottle, every surface tells a story.

topics.name: Classification of Surfaces
topics.description: Every closed surface is a sphere with handles or crosscaps. Genus and orientability.
topics.flavor: A complete catalog of all possible surfaces — a rare achievement in mathematics.

topics.name: Euler Characteristic
topics.description: V - E + F: the topological invariant that counts. From polyhedra to surfaces to higher dimensions.
topics.flavor: A single number that captures the essence of a shape.

topics.name: Knot Theory
topics.description: The mathematics of tangled loops in 3D space. Knot invariants and the unknotting problem.
topics.flavor: Is it really knotted, or can you untangle it? Harder than it sounds.

topics.name: Non-Orientable Surfaces
topics.description: The Mobius strip and Klein bottle. Surfaces where left and right have no meaning.
topics.flavor: Surfaces that twist reality — where inside becomes outside.

topics.name: Introduction to Manifolds
topics.description: Spaces that locally look like Euclidean space. Charts, atlases, and smooth structures.
topics.flavor: Locally flat, globally curved — the mathematical model of our universe.

subdomains.name: Differential Topology
subdomains.description: Smooth manifolds and differentiable maps. Where calculus meets topology.
subdomains.flavor: The Smooth Frontier — where the tools of calculus illuminate topological truths.

topics.name: Smooth Manifolds
topics.description: Manifolds with smooth transition maps. Tangent spaces, vector fields, and differential forms.
topics.flavor: A surface so smooth that calculus works everywhere on it.

topics.name: Morse Theory
topics.description: Understanding topology through critical points of smooth functions. A bridge between analysis and topology.
topics.flavor: The peaks, valleys, and saddle points of a landscape reveal its topology.

topics.name: Transversality
topics.description: When submanifolds meet generically. Sard's theorem and intersection theory.
topics.flavor: Most things that can happen, do happen — generically.

topics.name: Vector Bundles
topics.description: Attaching a vector space to each point of a manifold. The tangent bundle and beyond.
topics.flavor: A vector space at every point — geometry's way of packaging linear algebra.

topics.name: Cobordism
topics.description: When is one manifold the boundary of another? The equivalence relation that classifies manifolds.
topics.flavor: Two manifolds are cobordant if they're opposite shores of the same higher-dimensional sea.
